intro: Cicerbita villicaulis, commonly known as the hairy leaf cicerbita, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showing a preference for well-drained soils. It is often found in open woodlands and scrublands, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
